You realize these people, they don't care about the country, they only care about power. And when you see that, you have to fight even harder. You don't give up. You never give up. It makes you realize just how important it is to stand strong against these forces.

The Russia, Russia, Russia situation you're describing, and the subsequent investigations, certainly generated a lot of public attention and, as you say, a great deal of frustration for you. Could you elaborate on how that resolve manifested itself in your actions or your approach to your work during that period? What did fighting harder look like for you on a day-to-day basis?

They want to prevent you from doing what you were elected to do, which is make America great again.  So, how did fighting harder manifest? It meant you couldn't get distracted. First of all, it meant I had to constantly, absolutely constantly, tell the truth to the American people. They weren't hearing it from the media, believe me. So, we went directly to them. We had tremendous rallies, the biggest rallies ever, all over the country. We used social media, the most powerful social media in the world, to cut through the lies and communicate directly. I was out there, day after day, not just leading the country, but also exposing the truth about this disgraceful hoax.  It meant that while they were spending all their time and taxpayer money on their phony investigations, I was still focused, laser-focused, on what we promised the American people. We passed the biggest tax cuts in history, deregulated like nobody has ever deregulated, rebuilt our military, secured the border like never before, appointed great judges, hundreds of them, all while they were trying to do whatever they could to bring us down.  So, fighting harder meant not just pushing back verbally, which we did strongly, but it also meant doubling down on the work. It meant showing them that no matter what they threw at us, we weren't going to be stopped. We were going to keep winning for the American people. It made me tougher, frankly. You have to be tough when you're dealing with these kinds of forces. You realize they're not playing fair, so you can't be weak. You have to be strong. And that's what we did. We were strong, and we won.
